Core¶

class dubious.core.Context[source]¶

Bases: object

Context objects own the graph that stores the operations applied to uncertain distributions. Creating a context is not required to add Uncertain objects together, but it is preffered as merging seperate contexts can be expensive.

freeze(n=20000, rng=None, seed=None)[source]¶

Freeze the context. Sample once and cache the result for all future operations until unfreeze() or freeze() is called with a different value of n.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of samples.

  • rng (np.random.Generator) – NumPy random number generator.

  • seed (int | None)

Returns:

Array of sampled points.

Return type:

np.ndarray

property frozen: bool¶
property frozen_n: int | None¶

Return type:

float

Parameters:

  • a (int | Any)

  • b (int | Any)

property nodes: Dict[int, Node]¶
set_corr(a, b, rho)[source]¶

Sets correlation between to uncertain leaf nodes using gaussian copular.

Dubious uses Gaussian copula (rank/latent-normal dependence). rho is not Pearson correlation and the realized linear correlation can differ. Validate by sampling if a specific dependence measure matters.

Parameters:

  • a (int | Any)

  • b (int | Any)

  • rho (float)

unfreeze()[source]¶

Unfreeze the context, clearing the cache of all uncertain objects.

class dubious.core.Uncertain(dist=None, *, ctx=None, _node=None)[source]¶

Bases: Sampleable

A wrapper for distribution objects that allow them to be used as though they were numeric values from said distribution.

Parameters:

  • dist (Optional[Distribution])

  • ctx (Optional[Context])

  • _node (Optional[Node])

cdf(x, n=200000, *, rng=None, seed=None)[source]¶

Compute an approximation of the cumulative density function. Defaults to monte carlo simulation if other dsitributions are used as parameters otherwise analytic methods are used.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – Value.

  • x – Numer of samples.

  • rng (np.random.Generator) – NumPy random number generator.

  • n (int)

  • seed (int | None)

Returns:

Estimated CDF.

Return type:

float

static const(x, ctx)[source]¶
Return type:

Uncertain

Parameters:

  • x (int | float | number)

  • ctx (Context)

corr(u, rho)[source]¶

Correlate this Uncertain object with another using Gaussian Copular. Both objects must be a leaf nodes, meaning they have not yet had any numerical operations applied to them.

Dubious uses Gaussian copula (rank/latent-normal dependence). rho is not Pearson correlation and the realized linear correlation can differ. Validate by sampling if a specific dependence measure matters.

Parameters:

  • u (Uncertain) – The object with which to correlate.

  • rho (float) – Gaussian copula correlation parameter.

cos()[source]¶
Return type:

Uncertain

property ctx: Context¶
freeze(n, rng=None, seed=None)[source]¶

Freeze an uncertain object. Sample once and cache the result for all future operations until unfreeze() or freeze() is called with a different value of n.

This will only freeze a single uncertain object within the context. Context.Freeze() is recommended in most cases.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of samples.

  • rng (np.random.Generator) – NumPy random number generator.

  • seed (int | None)

Returns:

Array of sampled points.

Return type:

np.ndarray

property frozen_n: int | None¶

quantile(q, n=50000, rng=None, seed=None, method='linear')[source]¶

Compute an approximation of the q-th quantile of data. Defaults to monte carlo simulation if other dsitributions are used as parameters otherwise analytic methods are used.

Parameters:

  • q (float) – Probability of the quantile to compute.

  • n (int) – Number of samples.

  • rng (np.random.Generator) – NumPy random number generator.

  • seed (int | None)

  • method (str)

Returns:

Estimated quantile value.

Return type:

float
